channel.title: Observational on t-student
channel.description: Recent content in Observational on t-student

item.title: Propensity Scores 101
item.description: A propensity score is just the probability of receiving treatment - we have: $$ Propensity \ Score = \pi_i = Pr(trt = 1|X_i) $$ So if we had a single (pre-treatment) covariate, say age, on which the propensity score was computed we may have that older people were more likely to receive the treatment. Now, it can be the case that two people with different covariate values have the same probability of treatment (i.
